story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Afghanistan, there lived a young boy named Amir. Amir was a curious and kind-hearted child who loved exploring the world around him.

One day, as the sun began to set and the stars started to appear in the night sky, Amir's mother tucked him into bed and began to tell him a story. "Amir," she said, "let me tell you the tale of the wise old owl."

Long ago, in the dense forests of the Hindu Kush mountains, there lived a wise old owl named Sahar. Sahar was known throughout the land for his wisdom and his ability to see things that others could not. Every night, he would fly across the skies, guiding lost travelers and sharing his knowledge with those in need.

One evening, as Sahar soared through the sky, he spotted a lost fox cub wandering in the darkness. The poor cub was scared and alone, unsure of which direction to go. Sahar swooped down and landed gracefully beside the cub, offering his guidance and wisdom.

With the owl's help, the fox cub found his way back to his den safely. Grateful for Sahar's assistance, the fox promised to always remember the lessons he had learned that night.

As Amir's mother finished the story, she tucked him in and kissed him goodnight. "Remember, my dear Amir," she whispered, "just like the wise old owl, always be kind and helpful to others. And never forget that wisdom comes from listening and learning from those around you."

And with those words, Amir drifted off to sleep, his heart filled with the tale of the wise old owl and the importance of kindness and wisdom in the world.

The end. Goodnight, little one. Sleep tight and dream sweet dreams.
